title: A Tiny Boltzmann Machine
summary:
This article introduces Boltzmann Machines (BMs), a type of neural network used for unsupervised learning and generative AI, mimicking energy principles in physics. BMs consist of visible and hidden neurons with weighted connections. General BMs have connections between all neurons, making them powerful but computationally expensive to train.

The article focuses on Restricted Boltzmann Machines (RBMs), a special case where visible and hidden neurons are not directly connected. This restriction simplifies training. RBMs are energy-based models, where the energy of a network configuration is defined by the neuron states, weights, and biases.

The goal of training is to adjust weights and biases to minimize the energy of training data, effectively learning the probability distribution of the visible units. After training, the RBM can generate new data similar to the training data using Gibbs sampling.

The training process, Contrastive Divergence, involves: clamping visible units to training data, sampling hidden units, reconstructing visible units, resampling hidden units, and updating weights based on the difference between the data and the model's expectations. The provided simulator allows users to visualize the training process and observe how the RBM learns to reconstruct the input data. The Appendix provides a mathematical derivation of the Contrastive Divergence algorithm, detailing the weight and bias update rules.

本文重点介绍受限玻尔兹曼机（RBM），这是一种可见神经元和隐藏神经元之间没有直接连接的特殊情况。这种限制简化了训练。RBM是基于能量的模型，其中网络配置的能量由神经元状态、权重和偏差定义。

训练的目标是调整权重和偏差，以最小化训练数据的能量，从而有效地学习可见单元的概率分布。训练完成后，RBM可以使用吉布斯采样生成与训练数据相似的新数据。

训练过程，即对比散度，包括：将可见单元钳制到训练数据，对隐藏单元进行采样，重建可见单元，重新采样隐藏单元，并根据数据和模型期望之间的差异更新权重。提供的模拟器允许用户可视化训练过程，并观察RBM如何学习重建输入数据。附录提供了对比散度算法的数学推导，详细说明了权重和偏差的更新规则。

title: Show HN: Min.js style compression of tech docs for LLM context
summary:
This article introduces llm-min.txt, a new approach to compressing technical documentation for use with Large Language Models (LLMs). It addresses the problem of AI coding assistants lacking up-to-date library information due to their "knowledge cutoff." Unlike existing solutions like llms.txt (which can be excessively large) and Context7 (a "black box" approach), llm-min.txt employs AI to distill documentation into a super-condensed, structured summary.

llm-min.txt uses the Structured Knowledge Format (SKF), organizing information into DEFINITIONS, INTERACTIONS, and USAGE_PATTERNS sections, optimized for machine parsing rather than human readability. A companion llm-min-guideline.md file provides decoding instructions for AI interpretation.  The article claims token reductions of 90-95% compared to original documentation, significantly improving AI's ability to process and understand the information.

The article provides a quick start guide including installation instructions and example commands.  It also highlights the importance of using the recommended Gemini AI model (gemini-2.5-flash-preview-04-17) due to its advanced reasoning, large context window, and cost efficiency for the compression task. Finally, it provides a brief overview of the internal workings of the llm-min tool.

title: Malicious compliance by booking an available meeting room
summary:
In 2011, Larry Page, as the new CEO of Google, tried to improve meeting efficiency. He instituted a policy that meetings should have a decision-maker, be capped at 10 people, require active participation, and be scheduled for 50 minutes instead of an hour, leaving a 10-minute buffer between meetings. Google Calendar was updated to reflect this 50-minute default.

However, people didn't actually end meetings after 50 minutes. One team in the NYC office cleverly exploited this. Their standups were only 10 minutes long, and they noticed the calendar gaps created by the 50-minute default. They began booking those free 10-minute slots in meeting rooms, forcing longer meetings to end promptly at the 50-minute mark when the standup team arrived, adhering to the letter of Page's policy but likely frustrating many in the process. The author witnessed this happen twice and admired the team's dedication (or mischievousness) but never learned their identity or true motivations. The act was a perfect example of malicious compliance, exploiting the system's design to disrupt the status quo.

title: An Update on Fresh
summary:
This article provides an update on Fresh 2, a next-generation web framework built on Deno. While development took longer than expected, it's now in alpha and powering Deno's main website and Deno Deploy.

The delay was due to the need to enhance the underlying Deno platform and JavaScript registry (JSR), focusing on Node and npm compatibility to enable seamless integration of third-party packages and address issues with import maps and dependency management. Additionally, work on the next iteration of Deno Deploy, including a build step, served as a test case for Fresh 2.

Fresh 2 aims to be more extensible, faster, and easier to use. Key features include Express/Hono-like APIs, true async components, and a new plugin system for creating middleware. It also includes out-of-the-box support for precompile JSX, significantly speeding up rendering.

The alpha version (2.0.0-alpha.30) is available for testing, and users are encouraged to provide feedback. Deno 2.3 is recommended for the best experience, offering improved `deno compile` and local npm packages. Users can create new projects using the scaffolding script or upgrade existing ones with the update script. The stable release is targeted for late Q3 2025 (likely September).

title: Wavelet Trees: An Introduction (2011)
summary:
This article introduces Wavelet Trees, a data structure for efficiently answering rank queries on sequences over large alphabets. Wavelet Trees organize a string into a hierarchy of bit vectors, enabling rank queries with a time complexity of O(log₂A), where A is the alphabet size.

The construction involves recursively dividing the alphabet in half and encoding each half as 0 or 1, creating a binary tree. Each node in the tree stores a bit vector representing this encoding for the portion of the string it covers.  These bit vectors can be further compressed and indexed using structures like RRR or Sadakane and Okonohara's rank indexes.

A rank query on a Wavelet Tree involves traversing the tree, using the encoding at each level to guide the search to the appropriate subtree. The query performs binary rank queries at each node along the path until a leaf node is reached, providing the final rank answer.

The article also mentions that Wavelet Trees can be used in conjunction with Suffix Arrays for pattern searching, achieving a time complexity of O(P log₂A) where P is the pattern length.  The author encourages readers to explore select queries and Huffman-Shaped Wavelet Trees, and points to an implementation in Francisco Claude's libcds.
chinese_title: 小波树简介 (2011)
chinese_summary:
本文介绍了小波树（Wavelet Tree），一种用于高效回答大字母表序列上rank查询的数据结构。小波树将字符串组织成一个位向量的层次结构，从而能够以O(log₂A)的时间复杂度执行rank查询，其中A是字母表的大小。

其构造过程涉及递归地将字母表对半分，并将每一半编码为0或1，从而创建一个二叉树。树中的每个节点存储一个位向量，表示它所覆盖的字符串部分的编码。这些位向量可以使用诸如RRR或Sadakane和Okonohara的rank索引之类的结构进行进一步的压缩和索引。

在小波树上执行rank查询涉及遍历树，使用每一层的编码来引导搜索到适当的子树。查询在路径上的每个节点执行二元rank查询，直到到达叶节点，从而提供最终的rank答案。

本文还提到小波树可以与后缀数组结合使用进行模式搜索，实现O(P log₂A)的时间复杂度，其中P是模式长度。作者鼓励读者探索select查询和霍夫曼形状的小波树，并指出了Francisco Claude的libcds中的一个实现。

title: Model Organisms Are Not Static
summary:
This Asimov Press article, "Model Organisms Are Not Static," addresses the reproducibility crisis in scientific research, particularly concerning animal studies. It argues that genetic mutations accumulating in model organisms can significantly impact experimental results.

The article highlights a 2023 study showing that mutation rates vary widely among vertebrate species, with laboratory mice acquiring an average of 15 new mutations per generation. While most of these mutations don't affect protein-coding genes directly, they can alter gene regulation, potentially influencing experimental outcomes. The authors point out that the practice of controlled breeding in labs, which minimizes genetic diversity, can inadvertently retain deleterious mutations that natural selection would eliminate in the wild. 

The Jackson Laboratory's efforts to mitigate this issue through cryopreservation and periodic "resetting" of mouse genomes are mentioned, but even these methods don't fully prevent mutation accumulation.

The article suggests that scientists may be unknowingly attributing characteristics to these accumulated germline errors. It calls for researchers to consider more frequent sequencing of their model organism strains and to assess gene regulation patterns to exclude genetically altered animals from breeding programs. It also mentions that researchers are starting to cryopreserve other model organism embryos to limit the burden of mutations.

The piece concludes that researchers must actively confront the variability caused by these mutations to avoid exacerbating the reproducibility crisis. Recognizing the threat genomic change poses to reproducibility, researchers are starting to cryopreserve other animal model embryos to limit the burden of mutations. Fruit fly researchers have already developed a method to freeze fly embryos.

文章重点介绍了一项2023年的研究，该研究表明脊椎动物物种间的突变率差异很大，实验室小鼠平均每代获得15个新的突变。虽然这些突变大多不会直接影响蛋白质编码基因，但它们可以改变基因调控，从而可能影响实验结果。作者指出，实验室中控制育种的做法，虽然最大限度地减少了遗传多样性，但可能会无意中保留自然选择会在野外淘汰的有害突变。

文章提到了杰克逊实验室通过冷冻保存和定期“重置”小鼠基因组来缓解这个问题的努力，但即使是这些方法也无法完全阻止突变的积累。

文章暗示，科学家们可能在不知不觉中将某些特征归因于这些积累的生殖系错误。文章呼吁研究人员更频繁地对他们的模式生物品系进行测序，并评估基因调控模式，以将基因改变的动物排除在育种计划之外。文章还提到，研究人员开始冷冻保存其他模式生物的胚胎，以限制突变的负担。

文章总结道，研究人员必须积极应对这些突变引起的变异，以避免加剧可重复性危机。认识到基因组变化对可重复性构成的威胁，研究人员开始冷冻保存其他动物模型胚胎，以限制突变的负担。果蝇研究人员已经开发出一种冷冻果蝇胚胎的方法。

title: Lua for Elixir
summary:
This article announces the release of Lua v0.1.0, an Elixir library that allows executing sandboxed Lua code directly on the BEAM VM, thanks to the underlying Luerl library (a Lua parser, compiler, and runtime written in Erlang). The Elixir library enhances Luerl with better error messages and documentation. Key features include the ability to extend Lua with Elixir APIs using the `deflua` macro and `Lua.load_api/2`, and compile-time syntax validation using the `~LUA` sigil.

The library originated at TV Labs, where it's used to execute integration tests on physical devices by compiling a drag-and-drop automation builder to Lua. The author highlights Robert Virding, creator of Erlang and Luerl, explaining Luerl's origin as an exploration of implementing an imperative language on the BEAM.

Future plans involve merging the Elixir Lua library into Luerl to create a 2.0.0 release with improved error messages, stack traces, documentation, and sandboxing features, as well as deeper integration with the Lua ecosystem. The author encourages contributions via Slack, Discord, or GitHub.

title: Pathfinding
summary:
JuhrJuhr's devlog #9 details the pathfinding system implemented in their game, Deep Space Exploitation. The system is designed to handle a dynamic, destructible environment with Asteroids-style wrapping. The core algorithm is A*, enhanced with space partitioning to optimize world queries.

Key features include:

*   **Space Partitioning:** A tree structure divides the game area for efficient collision detection. Parent node queries determine if child nodes need individual checks.
*   **Dynamic Environment Handling:** A node's blocked state is cached but invalidated periodically (every 500ms) to account for moving or destroyed objects.
*   **Natural Paths:** A proximity rating based on distance from objects influences traversal cost, creating paths that prefer to avoid obstacles but can navigate close quarters when needed.
*   **Wrapped Paths:** The system handles game area wrapping by assigning border nodes neighbors on the opposite side. Off-screen nodes are added to guide NPCs around the wrap point.
*   **Efficiency:** Pathfinding is split across multiple game ticks to prevent slowdowns, balancing performance and asynchronous processing of path requests. Multi-threading was considered but dismissed due to the complexity of world state management.

JuhrJuhr emphasizes the satisfaction of creating a custom solution and prioritizes performance and natural-looking paths. The system has been tested and is now being integrated into NPC behaviors. Future improvements include selective invalidation of the query cache based on world changes.
chinese_title: 寻路
chinese_summary:

主要特点包括：

*   **空间划分：** 树结构划分游戏区域，以实现高效的碰撞检测。父节点查询确定是否需要单独检查子节点。
*   **动态环境处理：** 节点的阻塞状态被缓存，但会定期（每500毫秒）失效，以适应移动或被破坏的物体。
*   **自然路径：** 基于与物体距离的邻近度评分会影响遍历成本，从而创建倾向于避开障碍物的路径，但在需要时可以近距离导航。
*   **环绕路径：** 系统通过将边界节点分配给对面的邻居来处理游戏区域的环绕。添加屏幕外节点以引导NPC绕过环绕点。
*   **效率：** 寻路被拆分到多个游戏帧中，以防止减速，从而平衡性能和路径请求的异步处理。曾考虑过多线程，但因世界状态管理的复杂性而被放弃。

JuhrJuhr强调了创建自定义解决方案的满足感，并优先考虑性能和自然外观的路径。该系统已经过测试，现在正被集成到NPC行为中。未来的改进包括基于世界变化有选择性地使查询缓存失效。

title: A Rust API Inspired by Python, Powered by Serde
summary:
This article explores how to create a Rust API inspired by Python's dynamic capabilities, leveraging the `serde` crate for (de)serialization. The author aims to provide a more user-friendly interface than raw APIs, enabling users to query data with greater ease.

The article starts by demonstrating how a Python WMI interface elegantly abstracts system information. It then contrasts this with a rudimentary Rust API involving `Object` and `Value` enums, which requires verbose manual type checking.

The author proposes a more Pythonic design, allowing users to define structs representing data and query them directly. The initial approach involves creating a custom `Queryable` trait, but the author later transitions to using `serde`'s `Deserialize` trait for automatic implementation generation via `derive(Deserialize)`.

The core idea is to "trick" Serde into creating instances of user-defined structs from the raw API data, similar to how it handles different data formats like JSON. The article then dives deep into Serde's internal traits (`Deserialize`, `Deserializer`, `Visitor`, `MapAccess`) by manually implementing `Deserialize` for a `Fan` struct, illustrating how Serde manages the data conversion process. Ultimately, the article shows how `serde` can be used in an unconventional way to create a flexible and intuitive Rust API.
chinese_title: 受 Python 启发，基于 Serde 的 Rust API

title: California sent residents' personal health data to LinkedIn
summary:
A Markup investigation revealed that Covered California, the state's health insurance marketplace, was sending sensitive user data to LinkedIn via the Insight Tag, a tracking tool. This data included answers to questions about whether users were blind, pregnant, transgender, victims of domestic abuse, or used a high number of prescription medications, as well as their ethnicity, marital status, and chosen medical providers. This data collection began in February 2024 as part of an advertising campaign.

Covered California has since removed the trackers and is reviewing its security protocols. They stated the data sharing was part of a marketing agency transition. However, experts are concerned about the privacy implications of sharing such sensitive health data with a for-profit company like LinkedIn without user consent.

The situation has led to criticism and calls for investigation, including a request from Representative Kevin Kiley for the Department of Health and Human Services to investigate potential HIPAA violations. Covered California has acknowledged the inadvertent sharing and is reviewing the extent of the data involved. LinkedIn prohibits the use of its Insight Tag on pages that collect sensitive data.

The incident highlights broader concerns about the prevalence of website trackers and the need for stronger data privacy regulations to protect consumers' health information. LinkedIn is already facing multiple class action suits related to medical information collection.

title: Coinbase says hackers bribed staff to steal customer data, demanding $20M ransom
summary:
Coinbase revealed that cybercriminals bribed overseas support agents to steal sensitive customer data, demanding a $20 million ransom. The breach, which could cost Coinbase up to $400 million to fix, involved stolen information such as names, addresses, phone numbers, emails, masked bank account details, the last four digits of Social Security numbers, government ID images, and account balances. Passwords and private keys were not compromised, and Coinbase Prime accounts remained untouched.

The company detected the breach, terminated the involved employees, notified affected customers, and enhanced fraud monitoring. Coinbase is cooperating with law enforcement and refuses to pay the ransom. Instead, they are offering a $20 million reward for information leading to the criminals' arrest and conviction.

Despite the breach, Coinbase announced an acquisition to expand its global reach and will be added to the S&P 500 index next week. CEO Brian Armstrong aims to make Coinbase the top financial services app within the next 5-10 years. The company will reimburse customers who were tricked into sending funds to the attacker.

title: AlphaEvolve: A Gemini-powered coding agent for designing advanced algorithms
summary:
AlphaEvolve, a new AI agent powered by Gemini models, is revolutionizing algorithm design and optimization across various fields. This evolutionary coding agent combines the creative problem-solving of large language models with automated evaluators to enhance algorithms for math and practical computing applications.

AlphaEvolve has already demonstrated significant impact by improving Google's data center scheduling (recovering 0.7% of compute resources), assisting in hardware design (optimizing arithmetic circuits in TPUs), and enhancing AI training and inference (speeding up matrix multiplication in Gemini by 23% and FlashAttention kernel by up to 32.5%).

Beyond internal applications, AlphaEvolve is advancing the frontiers of mathematics. It discovered a faster algorithm for multiplying 4x4 complex-valued matrices, surpassing a 1969 solution. It also rediscovered state-of-the-art solutions for 75% of over 50 open mathematical problems and improved previously known solutions in 20% of cases, including advancing the kissing number problem in 11 dimensions.

AlphaEvolve's versatility allows it to tackle problems that can be described algorithmically and automatically verified, suggesting potential applications in materials science, drug discovery, and sustainability. Google plans to launch an Early Access Program for academic users and is exploring broader availability. The AlphaEvolve team believes that it will continue to improve as large language models become better at coding.

title: Gateway Books: The lessons of a defunct canon
summary:
This article explores the "gateway books" of a particular intellectual adolescence, focusing on authors like Salinger, Vonnegut, and Kerouac, and the ambivalence felt towards them later in life. The author recounts his own teenage reverence for these authors, only to find them less esteemed in college, leading him to adopt a new canon.

Prompted by his mother's request to clear out these boxed books, the author reflects on their lasting impact and explores whether others share similar feelings. A tweet asking about affinity for the "white male middlebrow canon" elicited a significant response, confirming a shared subcultural experience.

The article examines how these books, often bestsellers and countercultural touchstones, were discovered, frequently through serendipitous encounters in a pre-internet era. These books resonated with lonely, alienated teenagers, offering reassurance and a promise of belonging to a glamorous, avant-garde community. They often glorified antisocial behavior and male camaraderie, appealing to sexually frustrated adolescent males.

Ultimately, these books provided hope for a more exciting life beyond the confines of school and societal expectations. However, the author acknowledges that the "freedom" and "experience" promoted in these books were often vague and difficult to translate into concrete actions. The gateway books, with their inherent contradictions, served as a temporary escape and a promise of a different future, making the routine of adolescence bearable.
chinese_title: 门户书：一部废止经典的教训

在母亲要求清理这些装箱书籍的提示下，作者反思了它们所产生的持久影响，并探讨了其他人是否也有类似的感受。一条关于对“白人男性中产阶级经典”作品喜好的推文引发了大量回应，证实了一种共同的亚文化体验。

本文研究了这些书籍，通常是畅销书和反文化试金石，是如何被发现的，通常是在前互联网时代通过偶然相遇。这些书籍引起了孤独、疏离的青少年的共鸣，提供了安慰，并承诺他们可以加入一个迷人、前卫的社群。它们经常美化反社会行为和男性友谊，吸引了性欲受挫的青少年男性。

最终，这些书籍为超越学校和社会期望的更精彩的生活提供了希望。然而，作者承认，这些书籍中宣扬的“自由”和“经验”往往是模糊的，难以转化为具体的行动。这些入门书籍，由于其内在的矛盾性，充当了暂时的逃避和对不同未来的承诺，使青春期的日常变得可以忍受。

title: Working on complex systems: What I learned working at Google
summary:
This article, "Working on Complex Systems: What I Learned Working at Google," distinguishes between complicated and complex problems, emphasizing that complex systems require adaptive and novel solutions. The author identifies five key characteristics of complex systems: emergent behavior, delayed consequences, local vs. global optimization issues, hysteresis, and nonlinearity. Scale alone doesn’t make a system complex; it's the presence of these behaviors.

The author provides practical strategies for navigating complex environments, including favoring reversible decisions (Amazon's two-way door framework), thinking beyond immediate metrics by considering both local and global impacts, embracing innovation to find unique solutions, implementing controlled rollouts (feature flags, canary releases, progressive rollouts, shadow testing), prioritizing observability for system understanding and debugging, leveraging simulation testing (replaying past events, deterministic simulation testing), considering machine learning for adaptive pattern detection, and fostering strong team collaboration.

The key takeaway is the importance of recognizing the type of system you're working with (complicated vs. complex) and tailoring your problem-solving approach accordingly. Many systems exhibit a mix of both, requiring a nuanced understanding of when structured solutions suffice and when adaptability is crucial. The author's experience at Google underscores the need for unconventional thinking, data-driven decision-making, and collaborative problem-solving in complex environments.
chinese_title: 在复杂系统工作：我在谷歌的工作经验
chinese_summary:

作者提供了在复杂环境中导航的实用策略，包括倾向于可逆决策（亚马逊的双向门框架）、通过考虑局部和全局影响来超越直接指标进行思考、拥抱创新以找到独特的解决方案、实施受控发布（特性开关、金丝雀发布、渐进式发布、影子测试）、优先考虑可观测性以进行系统理解和调试、利用模拟测试（重放过去事件、确定性模拟测试）、考虑使用机器学习进行自适应模式检测，以及培养强大的团队协作。

关键在于认识到您所处理的系统类型（复杂与复杂），并相应地调整您的问题解决方式。许多系统兼具两者，需要对何时结构化解决方案足够，何时适应性至关重要有细致的理解。作者在谷歌的经验强调了在复杂环境中进行非常规思考、数据驱动的决策和协作解决问题的重要性。

title: The Fastest Way yet to Color Graphs
summary:
This article discusses a newly developed algorithm for coloring graphs, a problem relevant to various real-world scenarios such as air traffic control. The goal is to assign colors to the edges of a graph (representing paths or connections) in a way that no two edges connected to the same vertex (point) share the same color, representing avoiding conflicts.

Previously, algorithms for graph coloring were slow and had stagnated for decades. The new algorithm, developed by Sepehr Assadi, Soheil Behnezhad, Martín Costa, and others, achieves near-optimal speed by focusing on coloring multiple edges simultaneously instead of optimizing the coloring of single edges. They use a "priming" technique, inspired by home improvement, to prepare the graph for easier coloring. This involves randomizing the coloring of most of the graph, leaving strategic edges uncolored, which are then colored quickly.

The new algorithm's runtime is proportional to m log m, where m is the number of edges, making it "near-linear" and independent of the number of vertices. This is a significant improvement over previous algorithms, which depended on the number of vertices. Experts call it a breakthrough, though its real-world applicability depends on the value of the constant factor involved. The team aims to further improve the algorithm by removing the need for randomization and eliminating the logarithmic term to achieve truly linear time.
chinese_title: 图着色最快方法
chinese_summary:
本文探讨了一种新开发的图着色算法。图着色是一个与多种现实场景（如空中交通管制）相关的问题。其目标是以这样一种方式为图的边（代表路径或连接）分配颜色：连接到同一顶点（点）的任何两条边都不共享相同的颜色，代表避免冲突。

此前，图着色算法速度缓慢且停滞数十年。由Sepehr Assadi、Soheil Behnezhad、Martín Costa等人开发的新算法通过专注于同时着色多条边而不是优化单条边的着色，实现了接近最优的速度。他们使用了一种受家居装修启发的“预处理”技术来准备图，使其更容易着色。这包括对图的大部分进行随机着色，留下一些策略性的边未着色，然后快速地对其进行着色。

新算法的运行时间与m log m成正比，其中m是边的数量，使其“接近线性”且与顶点的数量无关。与以前依赖于顶点数量的算法相比，这是一个显著的改进。专家称之为一项突破，但其实际应用取决于所涉及的常数因子的值。该团队的目标是通过消除对随机化的需求并消除对数项来实现真正的线性时间，从而进一步改进该算法。

title: Researchers establish fundamental limit on how light bosonic dark matter can be
summary:
Researchers have established a new fundamental lower limit on the mass of ultralight bosonic dark matter particles, determining they must be heavier than 2.2 × 10-21 electron volts (eV). This is 100 times greater than previous estimates based on Heisenberg's uncertainty principle.

The study, published in Physical Review Letters, uses observations of the Milky Way's satellite galaxy, Leo II, to infer the distribution of dark matter. By analyzing the movement of stars within Leo II, the researchers created 5,000 possible dark matter density profiles consistent with the observed stellar kinematics using a tool called GRAVSPHERE. These profiles were then compared to density profiles created by quantum wave functions representing dark matter of various masses, utilizing a computational tool called JAXSP.

The team found that if the dark matter particles were too light, their quantum fuzziness (due to the uncertainty principle) would prevent them from concentrating in the way observed in Leo II. This allowed them to establish a stricter lower bound on dark matter mass than previously possible.

This finding puts significant pressure on existing models like fuzzy dark matter, which proposes particles with masses around 10-22 eV. title: Demystifying Ruby (1/3): It's all about threads
summary:
This article demystifies concurrency and parallelism in Ruby by explaining the roles of Processes, Ractors, Threads, and Fibers.

**Processes:** These are independent entities managed by the OS, running in parallel with isolated memory. Inter-process communication requires mechanisms like pipes or sockets.

**Ractors:** Introduced in Ruby 3, Ractors provide parallelism within a single Ruby process. Each Ractor is like a mini-VM with isolated memory, communicating via message passing to avoid shared memory issues. They bypass the GIL limitation for CPU-bound tasks.

**Threads:** In MRI Ruby, threads are managed by the interpreter and subject to the Global Interpreter Lock (GIL), allowing concurrency but not true parallelism for CPU-bound tasks. They are lightweight but share memory, potentially leading to race conditions if not synchronized properly. Threads are effective for I/O bound tasks.

**Fibers:** Fibers are the lightest concurrency mechanism, offering cooperative multitasking where control is explicitly passed between them. They also share memory and are best suited for building lazy generators or coroutines.

The article emphasizes that Threads and Fibers are low-level interfaces, generally used under the hood by Gems. Processes and Ractors provide true parallelism, while Threads and Fibers offer concurrency within a single process. The author concludes with a playful note on the Puma vs. Unicorn application server debate, which boils down to a choice between threads or processes respectively.

**进程：** 这些是由操作系统管理的独立实体，以并行方式运行，并具有隔离的内存。进程间通信需要管道或套接字等机制。

**Ractor：** Ractor在Ruby 3中引入，可在单个Ruby进程中提供并行性。每个Ractor就像一个具有隔离内存的微型虚拟机，通过消息传递进行通信，以避免共享内存问题。它们绕过了GIL对CPU密集型任务的限制。

**线程：** 在MRI Ruby中，线程由解释器管理，并受全局解释器锁（GIL）的约束，允许并发，但对于CPU密集型任务，不能实现真正的并行。它们是轻量级的，但共享内存，如果未正确同步，可能会导致竞争条件。线程对于I/O密集型任务非常有效。

**纤程：** 纤程是最轻量级的并发机制，提供协作式多任务处理，其中控制权在它们之间显式传递。它们也共享内存，最适合构建惰性生成器或协程。

本文强调，线程和纤程是底层接口，通常在Gem的底层使用。进程和Ractor提供真正的并行性，而线程和纤程在单个进程中提供并发性。作者最后以Puma与Unicorn应用服务器的争论为例，以轻松的语气总结，这归根结底是在线程或进程之间做出选择。

title: LLMs get lost in multi-turn conversation
summary:
This arXiv article, "LLMs Get Lost In Multi-Turn Conversation," explores the performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) in conversational settings. The authors, Philippe Laban, Hiroaki Hayashi, Yingbo Zhou, and Jennifer Neville, find that LLMs exhibit significantly lower performance in multi-turn conversations compared to single-turn, fully specified instructions. Specifically, the average performance drop is 39% across six generation tasks.

The study uses large-scale simulation experiments involving over 200,000 simulated conversations to analyze this performance degradation. The authors decompose the drop into two components: a minor loss in aptitude and a more significant increase in unreliability. They observe that LLMs often make assumptions early in the conversation and prematurely attempt to generate final solutions, which they then overly rely upon.

The core finding, highlighted in the paper, is that LLMs struggle to recover from incorrect assumptions or "wrong turns" taken during the conversation. This suggests a weakness in the ability of LLMs to maintain context, adapt to changing information, and course-correct throughout a multi-turn exchange. The research highlights the need for improved evaluation methodologies that move beyond single-turn assessments and consider the complexities of real-world conversational interactions with LLMs. The paper is relevant to researchers in Computation and Language (cs.CL) and Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC).

该研究使用了涉及超过20万次模拟对话的大规模模拟实验来分析这种性能下降。作者将性能下降分解为两个部分：能力上的轻微损失和可靠性的大幅增加。他们观察到，LLMs经常在对话早期做出假设，并过早地尝试生成最终解决方案，然后过度依赖这些解决方案。

title: Show HN: Muscle-Mem, a behavior cache for AI agents
summary:
Muscle-Mem is a Python SDK designed to optimize AI agents by caching and replaying tool-calling patterns, effectively creating a "muscle memory" for repetitive tasks. This approach aims to reduce LLM usage, leading to increased speed, reduced cost, and less variability.

The core concept revolves around caching agent behaviors and replaying them deterministically when the same task is encountered again. If the environment changes significantly, the system falls back to the agent's normal operation. Muscle-Mem is not an agent framework itself, but rather a tool that integrates with existing agent implementations.

The key to safe tool reuse is cache validation, achieved through "Checks". Each Check contains a `capture` callback to extract environment features and a `compare` callback to determine if the current environment matches the cached environment. Checks can be used as `pre_check` or `post_check` for tool calls.

The API includes an `Engine` class that wraps the agent and manages the cache. The `@engine.tool` decorator instruments tools to record their invocations and associated arguments. The article provides a practical example using a "hello" function, demonstrating how to use Checks to implement a timestamp-based expiration for cache validation.

The author encourages feedback and contributions, inviting users to join the Muscle Mem Discord, test the repository, and provide feedback.

title: Forget IPs: using cryptography to verify bot and agent traffic
summary:
This article addresses the challenges of verifying bot and agent traffic, which has become increasingly complex due to the rise of AI agents and the inadequacy of traditional methods like user-agent headers and IP address ranges. Cloudflare proposes two cryptographic solutions: HTTP Message Signatures and request mTLS, to provide a more reliable way for legitimate bots to authenticate themselves.

HTTP Message Signatures, a defined standard, allow bots to cryptographically sign requests using a public key known to the origin server. This signature includes a validity window, a key ID (JSON Web Key Thumbprint), and a tag indicating the signature's purpose. Cloudflare collaborates with industry partners like OpenAI, who already use this method. Example code in Chrome extensions is provided.

Request mTLS utilizes TLS flags to signal that a client supports authentication via a client certificate. The article introduces the "req mTLS" flag, sent by the client during connection establishment, allowing servers to request certificates only from clients that support mTLS without disrupting regular user traffic. The article includes examples of how req mTLS can be implemented and tested with experimental Go code.

Both methods aim to provide a standardized way for agents and bots to publicly authenticate themselves, enabling website hosting platforms to identify them accurately and manage traffic based on verified identity. Cloudflare is running a closed beta to test these proposals.

HTTP消息签名是一种已定义的标准，允许机器人使用源服务器已知的公钥对请求进行加密签名。 此签名包括有效窗口、密钥ID（JSON Web Key Thumbprint）以及指示签名用途的标签。 Cloudflare与OpenAI等行业合作伙伴合作，后者已经在使用这种方法。 文中提供了 Chrome 扩展程序中的示例代码。

title: Lightweight open source reCaptcha alternative
summary:
ALTCHA is a lightweight, open-source alternative to reCAPTCHA that protects websites, APIs, and online services from spam and abuse using a proof-of-work (PoW) mechanism. Unlike traditional CAPTCHAs, ALTCHA prioritizes user privacy with a cookie-free design, self-hosting, and GDPR compliance. It also adheres to WCAG 2.2 AA-level standards and the European Accessibility Act.

ALTCHA offers a frictionless user experience, leveraging PoW instead of visual puzzles. It's lightweight (17kB gzipped), ensuring fast page loads.  Both self-hosted and SaaS options are available.

The ALTCHA widget is distributed as a Web Component and integrates with various frameworks (React, Vue, etc.) and server-side languages (TypeScript, PHP, Go, Python, etc.).  It requires configuration via the `<altcha-widget>` tag, specifying either a challenge URL or a JSON-encoded challenge.

Configuration options allow customization of behavior, including auto-verification, artificial delays, UI appearance, and spam filter settings. Plugins enhance functionality with features like analytics, data obfuscation, and file uploads.

ALTCHA offers a Spam Filter API that analyzes form data to detect spam characteristics. It can be configured to block specific countries, enforce classifiers, disable rules, and check fields like email, IP address, and time zone.

The article also discusses Content Security Policy considerations, programmatic configuration, custom fetch functions, events, and contribution guidelines.

title: The cryptography behind passkeys
summary:
This article dives into the cryptography behind passkeys, focusing on how they provide a more secure authentication method compared to traditional passwords. Passkeys utilize key pairs to generate digital signatures, where the website stores the public key and identifier while the private key authenticates the user without transmitting sensitive information.

The article emphasizes the role of the WebAuthn specification in enhancing security beyond basic cryptography. WebAuthn adds origin binding, ensuring passkeys are only used for the website they were created for, combating phishing. It also mandates HTTPS for requests.

Two main types of authenticators are discussed: platform authenticators (integrated into devices, offering convenience and cloud backup) and roaming authenticators (hardware devices like YubiKeys, offering higher security isolation).

While passkeys mitigate phishing and password reuse, they aren't a perfect solution. The article outlines potential attack vectors, including browser-based attacks, compromised authenticators, and credential ID collisions. Websites should reject registration attempts with duplicate credential IDs.

Finally, the article explores WebAuthn extensions, such as `prf` and `largeBlob`, enabling functionalities like HMAC-SHA-256 calculations and secure storage of data like certificates or cryptographic keys within the authenticator. However, it cautions against using web cryptography for true end-to-end encryption due to the vulnerability of JavaScript-based systems to malicious servers.
chinese_title: 通行密钥背后的密码学

本文强调了WebAuthn规范在增强基本密码学之外的安全性方面的作用。WebAuthn增加了源绑定，确保通行密钥仅用于为其创建的网站，从而打击网络钓鱼。它还强制要求请求使用HTTPS。

文章讨论了两种主要的身份验证器类型：平台身份验证器（集成到设备中，提供便利性和云备份）和漫游身份验证器（YubiKeys等硬件设备，提供更高的安全隔离）。

虽然通行密钥可以缓解网络钓鱼和密码重用问题，但它们并非完美的解决方案。本文概述了潜在的攻击途径，包括基于浏览器的攻击、受损的身份验证器和凭据ID冲突。网站应拒绝具有重复凭据ID的注册尝试。

最后，本文探讨了WebAuthn扩展，例如`prf`和`largeBlob`，它们支持HMAC-SHA-256计算以及在身份验证器中安全存储证书或加密密钥等数据。但是，文章警告说，由于基于JavaScript的系统容易受到恶意服务器的攻击，因此不应使用Web密码学进行真正的端到端加密。

title: NASA Stennis Releases First Open-Source Software
summary:
NASA Stennis Space Center has released its first open-source software, a peer review tool designed to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of software application development, particularly for systems used in rocket propulsion testing. The tool was born from internal processes used to develop the NASA Data Acquisition System (NDAS), created to monitor and analyze data from these tests.

The Peer Review Tool streamlines the collaborative review process, enabling developers to build better software applications by identifying and addressing issues earlier. It's particularly beneficial for use with National Instruments LabVIEW, a graphical programming language where code comparisons are more challenging than with text-based languages. The tool automates steps, facilitates online commenting with pictures and other elements, and optimizes the reviewer's time by providing a focused environment.

NASA Stennis hopes that open-sourcing the tool will foster a community of users who will further refine and improve it. The goal is to create stronger software through robust peer review. The article also highlights the excitement and pride of NASA Stennis engineers in contributing to the open-source community and the hope for continued contributions. The tool is available on NASA GitHub.

title: Self-hostable webhook tester in go
summary:
This article introduces a self-hostable webhook tester for developers. It's a lightweight platform enabling developers to create temporary webhook endpoints to inspect and debug HTTP requests in real-time. This tool provides full visibility into HTTP requests, regardless of the integrated service (Stripe, GitHub, Twilio, or custom).

Key features include capturing headers, query parameters, and request bodies without backend code, allowing for response tailoring, delay simulation, and request replay to personal servers.

The tool works by generating a unique URL upon webhook creation. Any HTTP request sent to this URL will be logged and displayed in the dashboard. Users can then inspect headers, body, method, and other request details, and replay or forward the request as needed.

The article also mentions that while incoming webhook data is stored temporarily, creating a free account enables request log retention and advanced features like replay functionality. A curl example demonstrating how to send a POST request to a generated webhook URL with a JSON payload is provided.

title: Tipping Point: How America's Gratuity System Got Out of Hand
summary:
This article argues that the American tipping system has spiraled out of control and needs a serious reckoning. It traces the system's origins to post-Civil War America, highlighting how it was initially used to exploit Black workers by allowing employers to pay them substandard wages and relying on tips to make up the difference. This exploitative practice has evolved into a deeply ingrained norm, with tipping now expected in a wide range of situations, including self-service kiosks and automated checkouts.

The article emphasizes that tipping has transformed from a voluntary "thank you" to a mandatory expectation that companies exploit to underpay workers while shifting the moral burden to customers. Tipped workers can legally be paid as little as $2.13/hour, creating financial instability and a reliance on customer generosity. In contrast, Europe provides a different model where workers are paid living wages, eliminating the need for excessive tipping and fostering a more professional service environment.

The root cause of the problem, the article asserts, is corporate greed. By relying on tips to supplement wages, corporations save billions in labor costs, taxes, and healthcare benefits. The solution, the article suggests, is not to stop tipping altogether, but to push for systemic change: raise the federal minimum wage, eliminate the tipped wage system, support businesses that pay a living wage, and call out the absurdity of pre-service tipping prompts. It also encourages unionizing and starting ventures that fairly compensate employees without relying on tips. Ultimately, the goal is to rebuild a system where people are paid fairly, and tipping becomes a choice based on exceptional service, not a necessity for survival.
chinese_title: 临界点：美国小费制度如何失控
chinese_summary:
本文认为美国的打赏制度已经失控，需要认真反思。它追溯了该制度在南北战争后美国的起源，强调最初它是如何被用来剥削黑人劳工的，雇主可以通过支付低于标准的工资，并依靠小费来弥补差额。这种剥削行为已经演变成一种根深蒂固的规范，现在在各种情况下都期望给小费，包括自助服务亭和自动结账机。

本文强调，小费已经从自愿的“感谢”变成了强制性的期望，公司利用这一点来支付低于标准的工资，同时将道德负担转移给顾客。靠小费为生的工人合法地可以获得低至每小时 2.13 美元的工资，这造成了经济上的不稳定，并依赖于顾客的慷慨。相比之下，欧洲提供了一种不同的模式，工人可以获得维持生计的工资，消除了过度打赏的必要，并营造了更专业的服务环境。

文章断言，问题的根源在于企业的贪婪。通过依靠小费来补充工资，企业可以节省数十亿美元的劳动力成本、税收和医疗保健福利。文章建议的解决方案不是完全停止打赏，而是推动系统性变革：提高联邦最低工资，取消小费工资制度，支持支付维持生计工资的企业，并揭露服务前打赏提示的荒谬性。它还鼓励工会化和创办公平补偿员工而不依赖小费的企业。最终，目标是重建一个人们获得公平报酬的制度，打赏成为基于卓越服务的选择，而不是生存的必需品。

title: How to Build a Smartwatch: Picking a Chip
summary:
This article details the process of selecting a microcontroller chip for a new smartwatch, specifically the "Core Time 2" project. The author emphasizes that choosing the right chip is crucial due to its impact on software compatibility, power consumption, and cost. He shares his past experiences with chip selection for Pebble watches, highlighting the importance of software compatibility and the benefits of using familiar chips.

For Core Time 2, the initial plan to stick with Nordic's nRF52840 (used for Core 2 Duo) was reconsidered due to limitations in Nordic's newer low-end chips. The author explored alternatives from Apollo, BES, and Dialog but struggled to find options with open-source SDKs, a critical requirement for PebbleOS.

Ultimately, the choice landed on SiFli's SF32LB52J chip. This chip offers several advantages: ample RAM (512K SRAM, 16M PSRAM), a dedicated MIP peripheral for the watch's display, low power consumption, a competitive price point (under $2), and, most importantly, an open-source SDK with support for porting PebbleOS. The author highlights SiFli's experience in powering numerous existing smartwatches and the CEO's enthusiasm for supporting open-source development. This selection avoids the need for an FPGA or expensive display interface chip, simplifying the hardware design.

title: Interferometer Device Sees Text from a Mile Away
summary:
This Physics Magazine article discusses a new high-resolution imaging system that uses intensity interferometry to capture images of distant objects. Developed by researchers led by Qiang Zhang at the University of Science and Technology of China, the system employs multiple laser beams to illuminate a target and two telescopes to collect the reflected light. This allows for imaging millimeter-wide letters at a distance of 1.36 km, a significant improvement in spatial resolution compared to using a single telescope.

The core of the innovation lies in addressing the challenge of coherent laser light, which typically leads to intensity fluctuations dominated by shot noise. The team solved this by splitting the laser into eight beams, each traveling a slightly different path through the atmosphere, creating incoherent illumination that allows interference effects to be observed.

The system was tested by creating reflective letter targets and reconstructing their images by varying the separation between the telescopes and rotating the target. This demonstrated a resolution of 3 mm, far exceeding the 42 mm resolution of a single telescope.

The researchers plan to enhance the technology by improving laser light control and integrating deep learning into the image reconstruction software. Potential applications include space debris detection. Experts like Shaurya Aarav and Ilya Starshynov praise the advancement, highlighting its potential for remote imaging applications like monitoring insect populations and the clever method of delivering incoherent light to the target.
chinese_title: 干涉仪设备一英里外识字
chinese_summary:
该物理杂志文章讨论了一种新的高分辨率成像系统，该系统利用强度干涉法捕获远处物体的图像。该系统由中国科学技术大学张强领导的研究人员开发，采用多束激光照射目标，并用两台望远镜收集反射光。这使得能够在1.36公里的距离上对毫米宽的字母进行成像，与使用单台望远镜相比，空间分辨率有了显著提高。

这项创新的核心在于解决了相干激光带来的挑战，相干激光通常会导致强度波动，而强度波动又被散粒噪声所主导。该团队通过将激光分成八束光束来解决这个问题，每束光束穿过大气层的路径略有不同，从而产生非相干照明，使得可以观察到干涉效应。

该系统通过创建反射字母目标并通过改变望远镜之间的间距和旋转目标来重建它们的图像进行了测试。这证明了3毫米的分辨率，远远超过了单台望远镜的42毫米分辨率。

研究人员计划通过改进激光光控制并将深度学习集成到图像重建软件中来增强该技术。潜在的应用包括空间碎片探测。Shaurya Aarav和Ilya Starshynov等专家赞扬了这一进步，强调了其在远程成像应用（如监测昆虫种群）以及巧妙地将非相干光传递到目标的方法方面的潜力。

title: Show HN: Kudos.wiki – Discover the best movies on Wikipedia

title: Our narrative prison
summary:
Eliane Glaser's "Our Narrative Prison" explores the ubiquity of the "hero's journey" plot structure in modern storytelling across film, TV, and literature. She argues that despite the illusion of variety, a repetitive formula dominates: a protagonist in an ordinary world faces an inciting incident, embarks on a quest, encounters opposition, experiences a low point, and ultimately undergoes a transformative experience, returning home changed.

Glaser traces this structure back to Aristotle's *Poetics* and its subsequent development by thinkers like Freytag and its modern adaptation by scriptwriting gurus like Vogler and McKee. She contends that Hollywood perpetuates this formula due to its perceived replicability for box-office success, disguising convention as variety and constraint as freedom, mirroring the consumerist illusion of choice within a limited framework.

The author questions the implications of this narrative dominance. She suggests that while the hero's journey reflects deep-seated human needs, its formulaic application can be subtly conservative, prioritizing individual transformation within the confines of bourgeois norms over genuine critique of societal structures.

Glaser references Jung's "collective unconscious" and Campbell's "monomyth" as underlying influences, differentiating between the authentic human condition and the Hollywood adaptation that favors redemption and restoration of normality. She points to the power of narrative to shape public opinion, referencing Lippmann's call for Hollywood to control the masses and Salmon's observation of narrative's spread across various cultural and societal domains. Finally, she argues that while stories offer wish fulfillment and a sense of order, imposing a narrative structure on life can be a way of avoiding proactive change and that the "hero's journey" might be an illusionary way of experiencing change, rather than enacting it.
chinese_title: 我们叙事牢笼
chinese_summary:
艾莉安·格拉泽的《我们的叙事牢笼》探讨了“英雄之旅”情节结构在现代电影、电视和文学作品中的普遍存在。她认为，尽管存在多样性的假象，但一种重复的模式占据主导地位：一个平凡世界中的主人公面临一个诱发事件，开始一段旅程，遭遇阻碍，经历低谷，最终经历一次变革性的体验，带着改变回到家园。

格拉泽将这种结构追溯到亚里士多德的《诗学》，以及弗雷塔格等思想家随后的发展，以及沃格勒和麦基等编剧大师的现代改编。她认为，好莱坞之所以延续这种模式，是因为它被认为可以复制以取得票房成功，将传统伪装成多样性，将约束伪装成自由，反映了在有限框架内消费者选择的幻觉。

作者质疑这种叙事主导地位的影响。她认为，虽然英雄之旅反映了根深蒂固的人类需求，但其公式化的应用可能具有微妙的保守性，优先考虑在资产阶级规范范围内个人的转变，而不是对社会结构的真正批判。

格拉泽引用了荣格的“集体无意识”和坎贝尔的“单一神话”作为潜在的影响，区分了真实的人类境况和偏爱救赎和恢复常态的好莱坞改编。她指出叙事塑造公众舆论的力量，引用了李普曼呼吁好莱坞控制大众以及萨尔蒙观察到叙事在各种文化和社会领域传播的现象。最后，她认为，虽然故事提供了愿望的满足和秩序感，但将叙事结构强加于生活可能是一种避免积极主动改变的方式，“英雄之旅”可能是一种体验改变的虚幻方式，而不是实际行动。

title: How to Teach Kids the Importance of Digital Privacy
summary:
This article emphasizes the urgent need to educate children about digital privacy in a world rife with evolving online threats like AI deepfakes, identity theft, and sharenting. It argues that the digital privacy talk is now essential, akin to "the talk" about sensitive topics from previous generations, because children's futures are increasingly tied to their online data.

The article suggests practical steps for parents to take, including covering webcams, using devices with tailored privacy controls, reviewing social media settings, and setting up Google Alerts to monitor their children's online presence. It strongly advises parents to be mindful of "sharenting," limiting the public sharing of their children's photos and information.

The article also stresses the importance of open conversations about privacy, fostering a partnership where children understand the value of their digital footprint and are empowered to control their online reputations. It recommends playing OSINT games to illustrate how easily personal information can be pieced together online. Creating a "Family Media Use Plan" is encouraged to instill lasting privacy instincts.

Ultimately, the article highlights the need to teach children to share online deliberately and thoughtfully, respect others' privacy, and speak up immediately if they suspect a privacy breach. It advises parents to understand available legal protections, especially under COPPA for children under 13, and to contact their state Attorney General's office if rights are violated. The overarching message is that taking digital privacy seriously and modeling good behavior is crucial for children's well-being.

title: Show HN: I’ve built an IoT device to let my family know when I’m in a meeting
summary:
This "Show HN" post introduces Tabajara, an IoT device created by the author to visually signal when they are in a meeting to their family while working from home. The device, triggered by webcam usage, illuminates a red or blue LED panel.

The device is built around an ESP32 microcontroller running the Arduino framework, which connects to the home Wi-Fi network and exposes an HTTP server. This server listens for PATCH requests on the `/camera` endpoint, receiving JSON payloads indicating whether the camera is "on" or "off," and then activates the corresponding LED color.

To easily access the device without needing to track its IP address, the author leverages mDNS (Bonjour on Apple devices) to assign a `.local` hostname to the ESP32.

The system is completed by a Python daemon that periodically queries the Apple API to determine if any cameras are currently active. Based on this status, the daemon sends a PATCH request to the ESP32, updating the LED panel accordingly. The author provides a YouTube link to see the device in action and a GitHub link to access the source code. The solution is described as simple but effective in preventing interruptions during meetings.

title: Migrating to Postgres
summary:
Motion migrated from CockroachDB to Postgres due to escalating costs (a 5x increase to mid-six figures) and performance issues. While CockroachDB offered benefits like horizontal scaling and high availability, these weren't fully utilized given Motion's single-region setup and simple transactional queries.

The move was driven by several factors: frequent Prisma migration timeouts on CockroachDB, ETL job failures due to Airbyte connector issues, and inconsistent query performance where complex queries were significantly slower than on Postgres. UI/UX issues in CockroachDB, like confusing unused index reporting and cumbersome query cancellation, also contributed to the decision. Support responsiveness was also a concern.

The migration was executed using a custom ETL solution built with Bun. The process involved dumping CockroachDB data to files, transforming data to be Postgres-compatible, and streaming the data into Postgres. The migration itself took only 15 minutes, with a total downtime of under an hour.

Post-migration, Motion experienced a 33% reduction in aggregated request latencies and identified several unoptimized queries using Postgres tools like PGAnalyze. The migration resulted in cost savings of over $110,000 annually, even with conservative resource provisioning. The author highlights the high impact nature of the work and encourages interested individuals to consider joining Motion's team.
chinese_title: 迁移到Postgres
chinese_summary:
由于成本飙升（增长5倍至六位数中段）和性能问题，Motion已从CockroachDB迁移到Postgres。虽然CockroachDB提供了横向扩展和高可用性等优势，但鉴于Motion的单区域设置和简单的事务查询，这些优势并未得到充分利用。

此次迁移由以下几个因素驱动：CockroachDB上频繁的Prisma迁移超时、由于Airbyte连接器问题导致的ETL作业失败，以及查询性能不一致，即复杂查询比Postgres慢得多。CockroachDB中的UI/UX问题，如令人困惑的未使用索引报告和繁琐的查询取消，也促成了这一决定。支持响应速度也是一个问题。

该迁移使用Bun构建的自定义ETL解决方案执行。该过程包括将CockroachDB数据转储到文件，将数据转换为与Postgres兼容的格式，并将数据流式传输到Postgres。迁移本身仅花费15分钟，总停机时间不到一小时。

迁移后，Motion的总请求延迟降低了33%，并使用PGAnalyze等Postgres工具识别了几个未优化的查询。即使采用保守的资源配置，此次迁移也带来了每年超过11万美元的成本节约。作者强调了这项工作的高影响力，并鼓励有兴趣的人士考虑加入Motion团队。

title: Hegel 2.0: The imaginary history of ternary computing (2018)
summary:
Leif Weatherby's "Hegel 2.0: The imaginary history of ternary computing" explores the largely unrealized potential of ternary computing (using trits instead of bits) through the lens of cybernetics, German Idealism, and Cold War history. The article centers on Nikolai Brusentsov's SETUN, the only computer built on ternary logic, and its ultimate failure to gain traction due to bureaucratic obstacles and standardization efforts.

The piece contrasts the binary logic underlying modern computers with the potential for a more nuanced, Hegelian "Hegel 2.0" ternary system. It delves into the philosophical debates of the Cold War, particularly the clash between Soviet Marxism-Leninism and American cybernetics, highlighting Warren McCulloch's rejection of the dualistic thinking prevalent at the time. McCulloch, rather than visiting Moscow to see the SETUN, engaged in a philosophical rejection arguing for a Hegelian posthumanism that transcended the binary.

Weatherby argues that ternary computing's history is largely imaginary, existing more as emulation than implementation. Despite its technical promise, it never overcame the limitations of hardware development. The article concludes by suggesting that the unrealized potential of ternary computing, along with figures like Gotthard Günther's efforts to synthesize Hegel and cybernetics, provides a vantage point from which to critique the limitations and illusions inherent in our current binary-driven digital culture.
chinese_title: 黑格尔2.0：三元计算的虚构历史 (2018)
chinese_summary:
莱夫·韦瑟比的《黑格尔2.0：三进制计算的虚构史》通过控制论、德国唯心主义和冷战历史的视角，探讨了三进制计算（使用三进制位而非二进制位）在很大程度上未被实现的潜力。 文章以尼古拉·布鲁森佐夫的SETUN为中心，这是唯一一台基于三进制逻辑构建的计算机，但由于官僚主义障碍和标准化努力，它最终未能获得发展。

该文将现代计算机所基于的二进制逻辑与更细致、更具黑格尔式的“黑格尔2.0”三进制系统的潜力进行了对比。 它深入探讨了冷战时期的哲学辩论，特别是苏联马克思列宁主义与美国控制论之间的冲突，突出了沃伦·麦卡洛克对当时盛行的二元论思维的拒绝。 麦卡洛克没有去莫斯科参观SETUN，而是进行了哲学上的否定，认为有一种超越二元论的黑格尔式后人类主义。

韦瑟比认为，三进制计算的历史在很大程度上是虚构的，更多地是作为仿真存在，而不是实现。 尽管它具有技术前景，但它从未克服硬件开发的局限性。 文章最后提出，三进制计算未被实现的潜力，以及像哥塔德·君特试图综合黑格尔和控制论的努力，提供了一个视角，可以从中批判我们当前二进制驱动的数字文化中固有的局限性和错觉。

title: In the US, a rotating detonation rocket engine takes flight
summary:
Venus Aerospace, a US-based propulsion company, achieved a "historic" milestone with the first US flight test of a rotating detonation rocket engine at Spaceport America in New Mexico. This technology, long discussed academically, has the potential to significantly increase fuel efficiency in applications ranging from naval vessels to rockets.

The test involved a small rocket powered by a 2,000-pound-thrust engine, flying for approximately 30 seconds without breaking the sound barrier. Unlike traditional rocket engines with continuous combustion, rotating detonation engines utilize a supersonic shockwave traveling in a circular channel, driven by continuous fuel and oxidizer injection.

Venus Aerospace, founded five years ago by Sassie and Andrew Duggleby, aims to develop powerful rotating detonation engines to eventually build a hypersonic aircraft capable of carrying passengers across the globe in under two hours. While that long-term goal is distant, the company is focusing on near-term opportunities, positioning itself as a leader in affordable hypersonic flight for both commercial and defense sectors. They are currently engaged with US defense, national security agencies, and commercial partners to explore hypersonic applications in logistics, aerospace, and future mobility.

Sassie Duggleby emphasized the importance of continued government funding to maintain US competitiveness in hypersonics. While specific customers remain undisclosed, the successful engine test represents a significant step toward realizing the potential of hypersonic commercial flight.

title: Getting Started with Celtic Coins – Crude and Barbarous, or Just Different?
summary:

The author contends that Celtic coins were intentionally designed as they are, reflecting their artistic preferences.

The article highlights that early Celtic coins were imitations of Greek coins, but over time, the Celts developed their own style through disintegration, abstraction, and reintegration of the original imagery. This resulted in coins that may appear clumsy during the transition phase.

A key point is that understanding the original prototype helps appreciate the abstraction. The author uses the example of a Celtic coin derived from a Philip II of Macedon stater to demonstrate how tracing the evolution of the imagery reveals the underlying forms of Apollo and a charioteer, which are heavily abstracted on the later Celtic coin.

The article also discusses "Serial Imagery," where coin engravers made small, incremental changes based on previous designs, enabling tracing back to the original source.

Finally, the article notes the intentional use of dies larger than the flans, leading to incomplete designs on individual coins. This is interpreted as a deliberate choice to represent a spiritual dimension beyond the visible image, although it poses challenges for collectors seeking complete designs. The author emphasizes the precision used in weights and alloys, suggesting the die size was intentional.

title: High Available Mosquitto MQTT on Kubernetes
summary:
This article details how to set up a highly available Mosquitto MQTT broker on Kubernetes, specifically targeting k3s and Traefik, but adaptable to Nginx. The goal is to minimize downtime compared to a single Mosquitto pod deployment.

The solution involves deploying two Mosquitto brokers (primary and secondary) with a failover mechanism that switches traffic to the secondary broker within seconds if the primary fails. This is achieved using a `raymii-mosquitto-failover` pod that monitors the primary broker's readiness. The brokers are configured to bridge messages, ensuring near real-time message state on the secondary broker. Clients connect to a single LoadBalancer service (`raymii-mosquitto-svc`) which is dynamically rerouted.

Key components include:

*   **ConfigMaps:** Define configurations for both primary and secondary brokers, including bridging setup.
*   **Deployments:** Deploy primary and secondary Mosquitto instances, ensuring they run on different nodes using `podAntiAffinity`.
*   **Services:** Expose the MQTT brokers, including the main load balancer service with dynamic traffic routing.
*   **RBAC:** Grants the failover pod the necessary permissions to monitor pod status and patch the service selector.
*   **Traefik IngressRouteTCP:** Routes external MQTT traffic.

The failover pod runs `kubectl` within a loop to check the primary's readiness. Upon failure, it patches the `raymii-mosquitto-svc` to point to the secondary broker. While rare, downtime can still be ~5 minutes if both the failover pod's node and the primary node fail simultaneously. The setup utilizes message bridging to minimize message loss during failover and allows clients to automatically reconnect to the functional broker.  The author also explains why RBAC is necessary for the failover pod and why a simple shell script is preferable to a more complex custom controller.

*   **ConfigMaps:** 定义主代理和辅助代理的配置，包括桥接设置。

title: Why Is Geographic Mobility Declining?
summary:
This Economic Brief from the Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond explores the decline in geographic mobility in the U.S. over the past 30 years. The authors identify several contributing factors, broadly categorized into long-term trends and changes in geographic distribution.

**Key findings:**

*   **Overall Decline:** Interstate migration rates have steadily decreased across all age groups.
*   **Demographic Shifts:**
    *   **Population Aging:** Older individuals are less mobile, contributing to the overall decline.
    *   **Women's Earnings:** Increased earnings and employment opportunities for women reduce family mobility, as dual-earner couples are less likely to relocate.
*   **Geographic Distribution Changes:**
    *   **Wage Convergence:** Narrowing wage differences across regions reduces the incentive to move for higher pay in specific jobs.
    *   **Agglomeration Economies:** Highly educated individuals clustering in large cities (cognitive hubs) for specialized job opportunities.
    *   **Housing Costs:** High housing costs in desirable urban areas limit migration and reduce the ability of workers to reside where they are most productive. Additionally, people are less responsive to housing costs.
    *   **Young Adults Living with Parents:** Increased tendency due to high housing costs, limiting mobility.

**The authors conclude** that the decline in migration is driven by a combination of factors, including changing household needs, firm recruitment strategies, and, significantly, housing regulations that limit supply and increase prices. While household needs and firm behavior are important, the impact of housing regulations is an area of ongoing research.

title: Variadic Switch
summary:
This article explores different C++ techniques to emulate a "variadic switch" statement, which would allow expanding a parameter pack into a sequence of case labels within a `switch` block. The author aims to achieve assembly code as efficient as a hand-written switch, focusing on generating jump tables.

The article first demonstrates the assembly code generated by a simple `switch` and then replicates it using GCC's computed `goto` extension. This leads to using dispatch tables (arrays of function pointers) as a workaround, but the author notes that this approach quickly degrades and emits calls instead of jumps.

Next, the article explores using macros to generate multiple `case` statements and discarding those exceeding the desired range using `if constexpr`. However, this approach is limited to a specific number of alternatives.

A recursive `switch` template approach is presented, relying on compiler inlining to combine comparisons into a single `switch`. While promising, its effectiveness varies between compilers, with Clang being more successful at generating jump tables.

Finally, the article investigates fold expressions and initializer lists to create a sequence of conditional assignments. While Clang optimizes this into a switch, GCC and MSVC fail. The author then explores using chained `else if` statements to potentially assist the compiler in generating a switch statement.

In conclusion, the article highlights the difficulty of achieving a truly generic and efficient "variadic switch" in C++, showcasing different techniques and their limitations in terms of compiler optimization and portability.

title: SMS 2FA is not just insecure, it's also hostile to mountain people
summary:
The article argues that SMS-based two-factor authentication (2FA) is not only insecure but also discriminatory against people living in areas with poor cellular service, specifically highlighting the challenges faced by residents of the Appalachian mountains.

The author uses the example of their elderly friend in western North Carolina who struggles to access online accounts due to unreliable cell service and the reliance on SMS 2FA codes that she can't receive at home. While she has landline and internet service, Spectrum doesn't support SMS to landline, and shortcode SMS often doesn't work over Wi-Fi calling.

The article highlights the inconvenient and often impractical solutions required to bypass SMS 2FA in these situations: traveling to areas with service to switch to Time-based One-Time Password (TOTP) 2FA (if even available), contacting customer service (often impossible), porting phone numbers to VOIP providers, buying expensive signal boosters, or moving.

The author criticizes the false advertising of cell service coverage maps and notes that even younger, tech-savvy individuals in the region struggle with SMS 2FA. They also point out the usability issues with TOTP as an alternative, requiring app downloads and often confusing technical choices.

The article concludes that while SMS 2FA offers a convenient user experience when it works, it disadvantages a significant portion of the population living in mountainous regions with poor cell service and calls for a more inclusive approach to online security.

title: MicroPython v1.25.0
summary:
MicroPython v1.25.0 introduces several major features and improvements, marking a significant update after three years of development. The primary highlight is the "ROMFS" feature, enabling execution of bytecode directly from read-only, memory-mappable filesystems. This speeds up imports and reduces memory usage, particularly beneficial for resource-constrained devices. ROMFS is initially enabled on specific boards, with plans for broader implementation.

The release also includes a new "alif" port for Alif Ensemble MCUs, supporting multiple ARM cores and peripherals, including USB, dual-core support, octal SPI flash, and WiFi/BLE. Inline assembly now supports 32-bit RISC-V code, and Datagram TLS (DTLS) is supported for secure UDP connections across multiple ports.

The mpremote command-line tool gains recursive remove functionality and enhanced package management. Core interpreter improvements include enhanced string handling, a new build identifier, and a function to list mounted filesystems. The marshal module is introduced for converting code objects to/from bytes. The native linker now supports static libraries, enabling standard C functions in native modules.

The esp32 port is updated to support IDF v5.3 and v5.4, while the mimxrt port adds exFAT and UF2 bootloader support. Numerous board definitions are added across various ports, along with code size optimizations and bug fixes.

Overall, v1.25.0 focuses on improving performance, expanding hardware support, and adding features like ROMFS to enhance the functionality and usability of MicroPython.

title: EM-LLM: Human-Inspired Episodic Memory for Infinite Context LLMs
summary:
EM-LLM introduces a novel architecture for Large Language Models (LLMs) inspired by human episodic memory, enabling them to process virtually infinite context lengths without fine-tuning. It overcomes the limitations of typical LLMs struggling with extensive contexts. EM-LLM organizes token sequences into episodic events using Bayesian surprise and graph-theoretic boundary refinement in an online manner. This segmentation mirrors human event cognition.

Retrieval of relevant information is achieved through a two-stage memory process: similarity-based search and temporally contiguous event selection. This allows efficient and human-like access to information.

Evaluations on LongBench and $\infty$-Bench benchmarks demonstrate EM-LLM's superior performance compared to state-of-the-art retrieval models like InfLLM and RAG, even surpassing full-context models in many tasks. Critically, EM-LLM achieves retrieval across 10 million tokens, which is computationally infeasible for full-context models. The architecture leverages configuration parameters for controlling aspects like chunk size, block size, memory allocation, and boundary refinement. Evaluation can be performed using provided scripts and downloaded datasets. The paper also highlights a strong correlation between EM-LLM's event segmentation and human-perceived events, suggesting a connection to biological memory mechanisms.

在LongBench和$\infty$-Bench基准测试中的评估表明，EM-LLM的性能优于最先进的检索模型，如InfLLM和RAG，甚至在许多任务中超过了全上下文模型。重要的是，EM-LLM实现了跨越1000万个token的检索，这对于全上下文模型来说在计算上是不可行的。该架构利用配置参数来控制诸如块大小、块数量、内存分配和边界细化等方面。可以使用提供的脚本和下载的数据集进行评估。该论文还强调了EM-LLM的事件分割与人类感知的事件之间存在很强的相关性，表明它与生物记忆机制存在联系。

title: How “The Great Gatsby” took over high school
summary:
This article explains how F. Scott Fitzgerald's "The Great Gatsby" became a staple in American high school English curricula, securing its enduring popularity and literary significance. Despite Fitzgerald's initial worries about the book's failure, "Gatsby" gained traction after his death, particularly when it was distributed to American soldiers during World War II. Its appeal was further solidified by a mention in J.D. Salinger's "The Catcher in the Rye" and the publication of the first Fitzgerald biography.

The introduction of the Student's Edition with study guides and CliffsNotes cemented "Gatsby's" place in classrooms, enabling students to analyze its themes and symbols. The article highlights the impact of the New Criticism movement, which emphasized close reading and symbolic interpretation, making "Gatsby," with its rich symbolism, an ideal text for teaching these analytical techniques.

Teachers have used the novel to explore themes of the American Dream, materialism, and social class, often drawing parallels between the Roaring Twenties and contemporary society. While the article acknowledges the enduring presence of "Gatsby" in classrooms, it also notes the shift in educational priorities, with increased focus on nonfiction and informational texts due to initiatives like the Common Core and the AP English Language and Composition program. Despite these challenges, "The Great Gatsby" remains a significant work studied by millions of high school students, ensuring its legacy for years to come.
chinese_title: 了不起的盖茨比如何风靡高中校园
chinese_summary:
本文阐述了F. Scott Fitzgerald的《了不起的盖茨比》如何成为美国高中英语课程中的经典读物，从而确保了其持久的流行度和文学意义。尽管菲茨杰拉德最初担心这本书会失败，但《盖茨比》在他去世后逐渐受到欢迎，尤其是在二战期间分发给美国士兵之后。J.D.塞林格的《麦田里的守望者》中对它的提及以及第一部菲茨杰拉德传记的出版进一步巩固了它的吸引力。

带有学习指南和克里夫笔记的学生版问世，巩固了《盖茨比》在课堂上的地位，使学生能够分析其主题和象征意义。本文强调了新批评运动的影响，该运动强调细读和象征性解读，这使得拥有丰富象征意义的《盖茨比》成为教授这些分析技巧的理想文本。

教师们利用这部小说来探索美国梦、物质主义和社会阶层等主题，经常将咆哮的二十年代与当代社会进行对比。本文承认《盖茨比》在课堂上的持久存在，但也注意到教育重点的转变，由于共同核心和AP英语语言与写作项目等举措，对非小说类和信息类文本的关注日益增加。尽管面临这些挑战，《了不起的盖茨比》仍然是数百万高中生学习的重要作品，确保了它的遗产得以延续。

title: An accessibility update – GTK Development Blog
summary:
This GTK Development Blog post provides an accessibility (a11y) update, highlighting improvements made over the past year. The key development is the merging of the AccessKit backend in GTK 4.18, enabling GTK applications to be accessible on Windows and macOS for the first time.

The post also details progress in Wayland accessibility, specifically the implementation of keyboard shortcuts traditionally used by the Orca screen reader, closing a major gap in GNOME 48.

Georges Basile Stavracas Neto's efforts to make webkitgtk accessible, particularly within a flatpak sandbox, are also highlighted, resulting in GNOME Web becoming a fully accessible and sandboxed browser.

Furthermore, a new accessibility tool called Elevado has been released, providing an alternative to Accerciser for browsing and exploring application exposure on the a11y bus.

Beyond these major advancements, the post notes numerous smaller improvements, including added accessible labels, tooltips, and key bindings in the file chooser, improved list box information for Orca, button size warnings in the GTK inspector, platform state change notifications for ATs, improved shortcut and mnemonic reporting, better text attribute reporting, accessible libadwaita toast notifications, and improved accessible representations of libadwaita action row widgets. The author emphasizes that accessibility in GNOME is continuously improving due to the contributions of many individuals.

chinese_summary:

该文章还详细介绍了Wayland可访问性的进展，特别是实现了传统上由Orca屏幕阅读器使用的键盘快捷键，从而弥补了GNOME 48中的一个主要缺口。

Georges Basile Stavracas Neto为使webkitgtk具有可访问性所做的努力，尤其是在flatpak沙箱中，也得到了强调，这使得GNOME Web成为一个完全可访问且经过沙箱处理的浏览器。

此外，还发布了一个名为Elevado的新可访问性工具，它为浏览和探索应用程序在a11y总线上的暴露提供了一个替代Accerciser的方案。

title: Writing that changed how I think about programming languages
summary:
Max Bernstein's blog post highlights a collection of articles, papers, and talks that profoundly impacted his understanding of programming languages and compilers. He presents a curated list, each entry offering a transformative perspective on specific areas.

The highlighted pieces cover a diverse range of topics, including garbage collection (Andy Wingo's simple semi-space collector), compiler optimization (CF Bolz-Tereick's toy optimizer series and abstract domains using Z3), register allocation (Chris Fallin's Cranelift correctness approach), regular expression engines (Russ Cox's virtual machine approach), neural networks (Andrej Karpathy's micrograd), SSA form implementation (Fil Pizlo's approach using Identity tags), JavaScriptCore's optimization techniques (Fil Pizlo's Speculation in JavaScriptCore), compiler design for performance (Chandler Carruth's talk on Carbon Toolchain), bytecode interpreters (Allison Kaptur's Python interpreter), parsing techniques (Eli Bendersky's precedence climbing), code generation and register allocation (Takashi Kokubun's Ruby JIT challenge), compiler construction strategies (Abdulaziz Ghuloum and Fernando Borretti's incremental approaches), equality saturation and e-graphs (the egg project and Chris Fallin's Cranelift usage), and AST storage and representation (Bob Nystrom and Adrian Sampson's ideas on compact ASTs).

Bernstein emphasizes how each piece shifted his perspective, often simplifying complex concepts or introducing novel techniques. He includes a small correction to Wingo's garbage collector code and raises philosophical questions about code correctness. The post serves as a valuable resource for those seeking to deepen their knowledge of programming languages and compiler design.
